description: This course provides an overview of the emerging field of global health including a brief discussion of its historical roots. The course will focus on selected global health challenges of our times (e.g. HIV/AIDS, Tuberculosis, Ebola, Polio and Zika) as case studies. We will also examine violent conflict and its negative health impacts on displaced populations and refugees. Finally, we will discuss ethical issues in global health research, including student-led projects.
title: Global Health: Challenges and Promises
